examples: The clock says ten past two.
This clock loses two minutes a day.
The clock showed midnight.
The clock said three o'clock.
The clock is ticking away.
words.defineEn: a device used to measure and show time
words.defineVi: một thiết bị được sử dụng để đo lường và hiển thị thời gian

examples: Things like this take time.
Time is moving on.
The time passed quickly.
Time to bust a move.
The contractor is really taking their time.
words.defineEn: the quantity that is measured in seconds, minutes, hours, etc. using a device like clock
words.defineVi: số lượng được đo bằng giây, phút, giờ, v.v. bằng thiết bị như đồng hồ

examples: They set a date for a full hearing at the end of February.
I’ll check the dates.
The wedding date is set for next month.
We should mark the date on the calendar for our family gathering.
Her date failed to show.
words.defineEn: a specific day in a month or sometimes a year, shown using a number and sometimes a name
words.defineVi: một ngày cụ thể trong một tháng hoặc đôi khi là một năm, được hiển thị bằng số và đôi khi là tên

examples: This job puts years on you.
The apple tree in our backyard produces juicy fruits every year.
Cancer kills thousands of people every year.
The apple orchard typically yields a bountiful harvest each year.
Company profits took a tumble last year.
words.defineEn: a period of time that is made up of twelve months, particularly one that starts on January first and ends on December thirty-first
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian được tạo thành từ mười hai tháng, đặc biệt là một tháng bắt đầu vào ngày đầu tiên của tháng một và kết thúc vào ngày 31 tháng 12

examples: The days passed slowly.
The day brings a sense of vitality and liveliness to the world.
The news really made my day.
The hotel provides fresh towels for the guests every day.
Our car has seen better days!
words.defineEn: a period of time that is made up of twenty-four hours
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian được tạo thành từ hai mươi bốn giờ

examples: The journey to the airport takes about half an hour.
The hour is come.
The senator held the floor for several hours.
The agreement came after several hours of negotiations.
Buses to Oxford run every half hour.
words.defineEn: each of the twenty-four time periods that exist in a day and each time period is made up of sixty minutes
words.defineVi: mỗi khoảng thời gian trong số hai mươi bốn khoảng thời gian tồn tại trong một ngày và mỗi khoảng thời gian được tạo thành từ sáu mươi phút

examples: The clock said three o'clock.
Set the alarm for 7 o'clock.
The library opens at 10 o'clock on weekdays.
She finishes her piano practice at 7 o'clock.
The restaurant reservation is for 8 o'clock tonight.
words.defineEn: put after the numbers one to twelve to show or tell what time it is, only when it is at that exact hour
words.defineVi: đặt sau các số từ một đến mười hai để hiển thị hoặc cho biết mấy giờ rồi, chỉ khi nó vào chính xác giờ đó

examples: This clock loses two minutes a day.
Your plane leaves in ten minutes.
Programs are running a few minutes behind schedule this evening.
His first goal came in the 81st minute.
She was only five minutes late!
words.defineEn: each of the sixty parts that creates one hour and is made up of sixty seconds
words.defineVi: mỗi phần trong số sáu mươi phần tạo ra một giờ và được tạo thành từ sáu mươi giây

examples: Her second movie followed close on the heels of her successful film debut.
Her second movie followed close on the heels of her successful film debut.
Take the second road on the right.
Swimming is second nature to Jane.
She came second in the exam.
words.defineEn: each of the sixty parts that creates one minute
words.defineVi: mỗi phần trong số sáu mươi phần tạo ra một phút

examples: Morning brought no relief from the heat.
The morning is a time of new beginnings and possibilities.
My mother waters the plants in our garden every morning.
I had a letter from my brother this morning.
I got a call from Dave this morning.
words.defineEn: the time of day that is between when the sun starts to rise and the middle of the day at twelve o'clock
words.defineVi: thời gian trong ngày là giữa khi mặt trời bắt đầu mọc và giữa ngày lúc mười hai giờ

examples: The afternoon is a popular time for outdoor activities like picnics and sports.
The afternoon sun casts a warm glow on the buildings and trees.
We have a university lecture on art history this afternoon.
The weather turned quite chilly in the afternoon.
We had the run of the house for the afternoon.
words.defineEn: the time of day that is between twelve o'clock and the time that the sun starts to set
words.defineVi: thời gian trong ngày là giữa mười hai giờ và thời gian mà mặt trời bắt đầu lặn

examples: I really love summer evenings.
The college also runs evening classes in bricklaying and joinery.
Throughout the evening, the waiter handled the busy restaurant.
The party is on Friday evening.
Programs are running a few minutes behind schedule this evening.
words.defineEn: the time of day that is between the time that the sun starts to set and when the sky becomes completely dark
words.defineVi: thời gian trong ngày nằm giữa thời điểm mặt trời bắt đầu lặn và khi bầu trời trở nên tối hoàn toàn

examples: The night brings a sense of calm and tranquility.
The team stopped the rot with a 5–0 win last night.
They picked up the check for dinner last night.
The couple parted brass rags over their children last night.
Last night we served individual portions of chicken and mushroom aspic.
words.defineEn: the time when the sun goes down, it gets dark outside, and we sleep
words.defineVi: thời gian khi mặt trời lặn, trời tối bên ngoài, và chúng tôi ngủ

examples: Three players got their marching orders last week.
Our cat produced kittens last week.
My parents give me pocket money every week.
The rebels held the town for many weeks.
The week is divided into seven days.
words.defineEn: a period of time that is made up of seven days in a calendar
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian được tạo thành từ bảy ngày trong lịch

examples: Work on Sunday?
By Sunday morning she was running a temperature.
They gathered in the dining room for Sunday brunch.
Grandma's clabber pancakes are a family favorite for Sunday brunch.
She cooked a mouthwatering pheasant roast for her family's Sunday dinner.
words.defineEn: ‌the day that takes place after Saturday
words.defineVi: ‌ngày diễn ra sau thứ bảy

examples: Today is Monday.
I'm going monk mode from Monday.
Jessica died Monday.
I have a team meeting every Monday afternoon.
After a fun weekend I was back in harness on Monday, handling paperwork at my desk.
words.defineEn: ‌the day that takes place after Sunday
words.defineVi: ‌ngày diễn ra sau chủ nhật

examples: Tuesdays usually are my busiest days at work.
The Supreme Court heard the case on Tuesday.
The party will be on Tuesday, rain or shine.
I use Tuesdays to work on my personal projects and hobbies.
I meet my study group at the library on Tuesday afternoons.
words.defineEn: ‌the day that takes place after Monday
words.defineVi: ‌ngày diễn ra sau thứ Hai

examples: Wednesday is my favorite day of the week.
I have a lunch date with my best friend every Wednesday.
Wednesday is the middle of the week.
The deal will be agreed on Wednesday, knock on wood.
They're going on holiday on Wednesday so they're all over the moon.
words.defineEn: ‌the day that takes place after Tuesday
words.defineVi: ‌ngày diễn ra sau thứ ba

examples: Thursday is my daughter's favorite day of the week.
Thursday is the day after Wednesday and before Friday.
Thursday is almost the weekend.
I have a dentist appointment on Thursday.
Robbie opened his heart after a secret charity gig at London's Equinox club on Thursday.
words.defineEn: ‌the day that takes place after Wednesday
words.defineVi: ‌ngày diễn ra sau thứ Tư

examples: The party is on Friday evening.
His favorite band is playing a concert on Friday night.
US President Joe Biden got the clean bill of health on Friday after a detailed physical examination.
My friend's birthday is on a Friday this year.
Matt came round each Friday, regular as clockwork.
words.defineEn: ‌the day that takes place after Thursday
words.defineVi: ‌ngày diễn ra sau thứ năm

examples: A large crowd watched the game on Saturday.
The team should walk it on Saturday.
Saturdays are when I plan and prepare meals for the upcoming week.
I look forward to Saturday evenings because I meet up with friends for dinner.
France are playing against Wales on Saturday.
words.defineEn: ‌the day that takes place after Friday
words.defineVi: ‌ngày diễn ra sau thứ sáu

examples: My family and I look forward to the weekend every week.
They visit their grandmother every weekend.
Weekends are when I can work on personal projects.
They often visit their grandparents on weekends.
We often take weekend trips to nearby cities for sightseeing and relaxation.
words.defineEn: the days of the week, usually Saturday and Sunday, when people do not have to go to work or school
words.defineVi: các ngày trong tuần, thường là thứ bảy và chủ nhật, khi mọi người không phải đi làm hoặc đi học

examples: Next add the flour.
The school semester starts next month.
Next year sees the centenary of Saint-Saëns' death.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
Our next class will take the form of a debate.
words.defineEn: coming immediately after a person or thing in time, place, or rank
words.defineVi: đến ngay sau một người hoặc vật trong thời gian, địa điểm, hoặc thứ hạng

examples: She went halves on gas.
Buses to Oxford run every half hour.
The journey to the airport takes about half an hour.
He never does things by halves.
I bought these shoes at half price.
words.defineEn: either of two equal parts into which something can be divided
words.defineVi: một trong hai phần bằng nhau mà một cái gì đó có thể được chia
